alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:32PM PST until December 08 at 7:51AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River Above Doty affecting Lewis County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including La Push, McDonald Bridge, Sequim, Potlatch, Satsop, Montesano...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the South West Region...including Mud Mtn. Dam Outflow, R Street Bridge, South Prairie, Fairfax, Orting, Puyallup, National, McKenna, Rainier, Packwood, Randle, Mayfield Dam...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Bucoda, Centralia, Chehalis, Doty, Centralia, Grand Mound, Porter...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Grand Mound. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 142.5 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will flood several roads in Independence Valley with swiftly moving water including SR-12 and James, Independence, Moon and Anderson Roads. Flood waters will cut off access to and from Chehalis Reservation and inundate nearby farm lands. Some residential structures may be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 139.1 feet. - Flood stage is 141.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 142.8 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
